messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: The Hunger Games happen every year. The government uses the games to punish the people from different areas. This is because they did not follow the rules in the past. Every year, they choose one boy and one girl from each area. The children are 12 to 18 years old. These chosen children are called 'tributes'. The tributes must fight in a battle. Only one person can stay alive. Everyone in the country has to watch the games on television.

metadata.feedback_text: FAILED. The text uses the words 'punish' and 'battle', which are B1 level. This violates the strict A2 vocabulary rule. An A2 text must exclusively use A2 or lower vocabulary. 'Battle' could be replaced with 'a big fight'. The simplification of sentence structure and other vocabulary is good, but the use of B1 words is a critical error.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: The Hunger Games happen every year. The government uses the games to show the people what happens when they do something wrong. In the past, the people did not follow the rules. Every year, they choose one boy and one girl from each area. The children are 12 to 18 years old. These chosen children have a special name. They are called 'tributes'. The tributes must fight in a big fight. Only one person can stay alive. Everyone in the country has to watch the games on television.

metadata.feedback_text: The text is a flawless example of A2 writing. All vocabulary is within the A1-A2 range. Complex concepts from the original text, such as 'punished for rebelling', have been expertly simplified into clear, declarative sentences ('show the people what happens when they do something wrong. In the past, the people did not follow the rules'). Sentence structure is simple and direct. The keyword 'tributes' is introduced and explained perfectly. No corrections are necessary.
